title: Alulutho Tshakweni
text:
Alulutho Tshakweni (born ) is a South African <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player for the <a href="Free%20State%20Cheetahs">Free State Cheetahs</a> in the <a href="Currie%20Cup">Currie Cup</a>. His regular position is prop.
Rugby career.
Tshakweni was born in <a href="East%20London%2C%20Eastern%20Cape">East London</a> and earned a provincial call-up at high school level, playing for the at the Under-18 Academy Week in 2015 and at the Under-18 <a href="Craven%20Week">Craven Week</a> in 2016. For the 2017 season, he moved to the <a href="Port%20Elizabeth">Port Elizabeth</a>-based , playing for their Under-19 team in the <a href="2017%20Under-19%20Provincial%20Championship">2017 Under-19 Provincial Championship</a>.
In 2018, Tshakweni was included in the <a href="South%20Africa%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">South Africa Under-20</a> squad for the <a href="2018%20World%20Rugby%20Under%2020%20Championship">2018 World Rugby Under 20 Championship</a> held in <a href="France">France</a>. He played off the bench in all three of South Africa's matches in <a href="2018%20World%20Rugby%20Under%2020%20Championship%23Pool%20C">Pool C</a> of the competition, featuring in victories over <a href="Georgia%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">Georgia</a> and <a href="Ireland%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">Ireland</a>, and scored a try in their final pool match, a 29–46 defeat to the <a href="France%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">hosts</a>. He was promoted to the starting lineup for their semifinal match against <a href="England%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">England</a> — a 31–32 defeat that saw the team eliminated from the Cup competition — and their 3rd-place play-off match against <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">New Zealand</a>, helping them to a 40–30 win.
After the Under-20 competition, Tshakweni joined the <a href="Pretoria">Pretoria</a>-based on a short-term deal for the remainder of the 2018 season, and appeared for the side in the <a href="2018%20Under-21%20Provincial%20Championship">2018 Under-21 Provincial Championship</a>, scoring a try in his side's 149–13 victory over . In November 2018, he returned to Port Elizabeth, where he was drafted into the ' <a href="Pro14">Pro14</a> squad. He was named on the bench for their match against , and came on as a yellow card replacement in the 35th minute of the match to make his first class debut in a 14–31 defeat.
